"I'm a pretty big fan of Black Flag and Misfits too. What about you, what other bands do you like?"
"I haven't but I will check them out. Queen is one of my absolute favorites. I like the Decemberists too."
"That's cool, have you ever had the opportunity to see any of your favorite artists play live?"
"I've seen the Decemberists in concert. And Bon Jovi once. How about you?"
"Oh that must have been pretty fun! I've been lucky enough to have seen Black Flag quite a while ago, it was great. Do you play any instruments yourself?"
"I used to play the trumpet, the baritone and the piano. I miss Piano."
"Wow, you're quite multi-talented there. How come you no longer play them anymore?"
"I no longer have a piano and I live in an apartment. No way to practice the trumpet without disturbing the neighbors."
"Aw I'm sorry to hear that, I hope one day you're able to pick them up again in some way. So what do you do for work?"
"It's okay, someday I'll have a house and can get a piano. I'm a lab tech at a cancer institute. You?"
"That's a good attitude to have. That sounds like an interesting job, do you enjoy it? I work nights outside a punk rock club, I watch the door for them."
"It's very interesting. Very busy. I bet you see some interesting people."

"I stormed out and haven't talked to them since"
"Oh that's too bad, I can imagine how frustrating that would feel."

"Man siblings can be tough to deal with- is he your only sibling?"

"Yeah and he's the youngest. Always been the favorite. Do you have any siblings?"
"Yes I have five siblings actually and they definitely can be a bother some days. Have you talked to your family about how you feel?"

"I have in the past and they just tell me to get over it. I can't even imagine having 5 siblings"
"We were different ages so not all five had to live together at once for more than a year or two. It's too bad they don't listen to you."

"Oh that doesn't seem too bad. I'm just waiting until I'm 18 and then I'm going to move out and cut them out of my life"
"Oh that's good, just enjoy it while it lasts because once you grow up you can really miss living with them."

"Yeah I can see that. It's just going to take some time to heal. Do you get along with your parents?"
"I don't get to speak to them much anymore actually and I always really miss them and my siblings."

"Lots of people think we are following them...but I can't tell you if we really are...then they run!"

"He's okay now, he managed to pull through after a bit but it was sure scary at first, it's hard seeing a parent like that"
"I know what you mean. It really makes you re-evaluate your priorities. "

"For sure, it's a big life changer. Do you still have both your parents?"
"I do but my dad is actually pretty sick too. My fiance and I have decided to move up our wedding."

"Oh my that's really rough. So you know what it's like then. How long have you known your fiance for?"
"It's been 5 years. We were originally planning a huge wedding, but now we're just getting married in a park."

"That sounds nice, I personally have been to many weddings and sometimes the simpler ones are the best. When are you having the wedding?"
"It's in 2 weeks! And then we are going to Niagara Falls for our honeymoon. Can't wait!"

"Oh how lovely! Niagara Falls is great, I've been there before. That wedding is coming up fast, are you excited?"
"Yes definitely excited. Although it will be bittersweet because of my dad's health, of course. "

"I'm so very sorry to hear that. Do you think he'll be able to walk you down the aisle still? "
"I think so, yes! We're trying to keep things simple, so it won't be much walking. It should be Ok."

column3:
"I can always help myself, that's very important, then I can help others after helping myself."
"Do you feel that helping others should be equally important to helping yourself, though? "
"That depends on the person.  Some people help others more than they help themselves and some people don't help others at all."
"That is true but at the same time should help really be given on that basis? We should not just help others because we might get help in return. "
"Oh I didn't mean it with the hope of getting something in return.  Just that you can help for the sake of helping to all sorts of degrees."
"True. For example, I love to read books and when I've finished reading I donate them to a local charity shop. "
"And you have no regrets about doing that?  Like potentially rereading those books someday?'
"No - though I admit that my very favourite books I do keep. But giving books away is an idiosyncracy of mine - like scratching my nose for fun!'
"That's very generous of you, I'm definitely not that kind.  I do love animals though, maybe I should volunteer."
"I own rescue animals myself - it's a wonderful thing to do "
"That's great!  All kinds of animals or specific ones?"
"I have three rescue cats and one dog. "

'Nothing interesting. Just a boring office job. Kinda just go in and cash out sort of deal, you know?'
"yeah, i've done that. not now, though, i freelance so i work from home."
'That sounds interesting. Does it save you a lot of time for hobbies and relaxation?'
'eh, somewhat. i'm not super social though. i'd rather stay home and be online. are you a big social media person?'
'I like to browse reddit and stuff occasionally, if that counts as social media.'
'i think so. i usually just scan twitter and look for funny stuff. i follow lots of people, celebrities mostly'
"Ah. Yeah I scan twitter occasionally, too. I don't see the appeal of interacting with folks I know irl tho"
'i probably have more "friends" online than irl. i don\'t really do well in face-to-face situations.'
"I think it's easier to find people with your exact interests through the internet."
"that's true, especially for dating. much easier to sort through online profiles than try to talk to people at a bar or whatever"

'Haha, she's probably buried in a grave' 
'I've read some of her poetry. She was a pretty sad person.'

'What struck you as sad?'
'She was just a lonely person. She was a hermit who lived alone. It reflects in her writing. '

'Do you think there is beauty in the sadness of her poetry?'
"I do see beauty in it, but I wonder what beautiful things she could have achieved if she'd gotten the help she needed."

"Perhaps she wouldn't be famous then, if her predicament were different"
'You might be right. Do you do anything creative, yourself?'

'Not really, wbu?'
"I draw and write occasionally, but I'm not particularly skilled at either. It's more hobbyist than anything serious."

'I tried picking up digital drawing, but i quit after being so bad'
"It takes a lot of practice, but not everyone wants to go through the learning process and that's okay! Do what you think is fun."

"I've been there multiple times. Any other places?"
"You should definitely visit Japan! There is so much cool culture there and the landscape is beautiful."

"Honestly I would prefer Europe. Have you ever been in Japan?"
"I have not been to Japan but I want to so much. I would love to visit Europe too. I want to see the Sistine Chapel"

"Maybe we can go together. When do you expect to be available?"
"I should be available after the holidays. Maybe some time in January. Does that work for you?"

"That's fantastic. Here is a deal: I pay for the airfare, you pay for the hotel. "
"I like that idea. I'll try to make sure I find us some place very comfortable with a great breakfast!"

"Do we need visas to cross the border?"
"I think there are some places that do require a Visa. I will look into it before we make our final plans"

"OK, that's very important. Also do not forget to renew your passport."
"Oh yeah, I almost forgot about that! I have never actually had to get a passport before."

"Very well. This trip should help to my brother to stay alone and think about his life."
"I think it will bring you and your brother closer together and that's a great thing!"

"He has been having a lot of problems lately. Our parents were not able to help."
"Well at least this vacation can be of some help to you. I can't wait! Thanks for the chat."

Actually I have! In the last few months I got a new job as a flight attendant and I have been to some seriously cool place!
"That is pretty sweet! What is your favorite country you've been to so far?"

I really love Ireland. It's sooo green (my favorite color) and the people there are wonderful. Plus the architecture is unparalleled.
"I would love to go to Ireland. Sounds like a great opportunity! Is it difficult to become a flight attendant?"

It's not terribly hard. I had to go through some schooling for it and then on the job training, but it was worth it. What do you do?
"Well I am 15 so I don't have a job just yet. But I try to do dog sitting for people in my spare time. I absolutely love animals."

You have a lot of time to figure it out. Animals are always drawn to me. I'd love a dog but I'm gone all the time.
"Animals have to have a lot of love and attention so it's probably good you don't have one. But you can always visit a petting zoo."

That's true. I try to go to major zoos when I'm in a new city but I don't always have time.
"Yes, aquariums too! if you ever come through Atlanta you have to visit the Georgia aquarium. They have 4 huge whale sharks!"

That would be fun! I've never been there before. I did just go to the one in New Orleans though. It was amazing!
"I will have to try to visit that one too. Did they have a lot of tropical fish? I enjoy fish of many different colors."

They had a bunch but I'm from the Midwest and I thought it was odd they had deer at the zoo too.
"Oh that is interesting. I used to live in Colorado and you would see deer in passing all the time. In any case, it was lovely talking with you!"

"I love pita bread with hummus, it's great. What sort of Italian food do you like?"
"I am impartial to pasta. I love parmesan cheese!"
"This might sound silly, but which type do you prefer? My kids all like different sorts."
"I think I like angel hair pasta the best because it is so fine and tasty."
"My daughter loves angel hair the best, my two sons prefer spaghetti though. She's just like me, us ladies prefer daintier things."
"Oh yes! Whenever I have a thicker noodle I feel like I'm about to choke on it."
"Do you like pizza or anything else? Pasta is your favorite?"
"I love pizza! Sometimes I make it myself. Somehow everything is tastier when you make it yourself. And you can make it healthy too"
"I love making my own thin crust white pies, especially with artichoke hearts."
"That sounds so yummy! Do you enjoy coffee? I am a barista so I am quite the coffee connoisseur."
"Oh, yes. Being a mother of three practically requires a loyalty membership card at Starbucks."
"Well you should definitely try the iced caramel macchiato. My absolute favorite! What is your favorite?"
"I just like plain ice coffee, with cream and sugar - maybe some vanilla."
"Sometimes simple is best! Thank you for the chat! It was lovely talking with you."

column3:
"Yeah I got a warranty but it's so annoying, do you drive a car?"
"Yes, I couldn't live without my car.  I pick up my grandchildren from school each day, they are my world.  I couldn't do that without driving."

"Aww that sounds lovely, do you listen to music with them? Like Justin Bieber?"
"No they can't sit still long enough.  I listen to my headphones, I like oldies, like The Beatles."

"Cool, I'm listening to Olivia Newton-John right now! "
"I love her!  We like to be outdoors, walk to the lake near my house.  The kids love that.  Do you like being outside?"

"I do, I really enjoy going camping. Sometimes my family comes with me and we have a great time."
"That sounds nice!  Camping can be alot of fun.  Where do you camp?"

"We have some awesome parks here in England that I go to. Where are you from?"
"I was born and raised in Romeo, Michigan.  I am still there, I love it here.  I don't think I will ever leave."

"I don't think I've heard of it, I would love to travel to different places."
"You should come visit me!  I think you would like it.  There are also tons of campgrounds."
